turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Goldsmith–Schiffman Field.
turn.1: What is the difference between Goldsmith -Schiffman and a regular stadium?
turn.2: Goldsmith–Schiffman Field Goldsmith–Schiffman Field is a multi-purpose stadium in Huntsville, Alabama.
turn.3: What is the stadium used for?
turn.4: From 1934 through 2012, it was used mainly for middle school and high school football.
turn.6: It was also home to the Huntsville Rockets from 1962 through 1967 and the now-defunct Alabama Renegades of the National Women's Football Association.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: On January 25, 1934, Oscar Goldsmith, Lawrence B. Goldsmith, Annie Schiffman Goldsmith, Robert L. Schiffman, and Elsie Strauss Schiffman gave the property to the city for an "athletic field or playground "for the enjoyment of the white students of the public schools. " The Civil Works Administration provided $6,500 in materials and labor to construct the field, the first in Huntsville to accommodate night athletic games.
turn.10: The field was dedicated during the first night game on October 4, 1934, when 1,000 fans saw Coach Milton Frank's Huntsville High team defeat Gadsden High.
turn.12: The racist language in the deed was unenforceable and ignored as desegregation came to Huntsville City Schools.
